intro: Dorstenia psilurus var. subintegrifolia, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often hairy stems that store water, adapting to arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually lobed and have a distinctive, sometimes serrated margin. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
